text: Alex Shaw (22 November 1924 – 4 January 2013) was a Canadian former international soccer player. ==Career== After playing with Strathclyde, Shaw signed with Dundee United in 1949, where he played for two seasons, appearing in 12 matches league matches, scoring five goals.http://www.neilbrown.newcastlefans.com/dundeeutd/dundeeutd.html In 1952, he played in the National Soccer League with Toronto St. Andrews. He later played with Toronto Thistle and coached Toronto Ulster United. He made his debut for the Canada men's national soccer team on 6 July 1957 against the United States in a World Cup qualifier match. He died on 4 January 2013 in Perry Sound, Ontario. ==References== Category:Canadian soccer coaches Category:Canadian soccer players Category:Canada men's international soccer players Category:Association football inside forwards Category:Dundee United F.C. players Category:Canadian National Soccer League players Category:1924 births Category:2013 deaths Category:People from Glasgow Category:Scottish footballers Category:Strathclyde F.C. players Category:Scottish Football League players
title: Alex Shaw (soccer)
